area_name: South and West Faces of Ceremonial Rock

content.description: Clean face with horizontal and diagonal cracks. Though most often toproped, this climb is easily protectable and is a fun lead on excellent rock.
content.protection: Small to medium cams. 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: The South Face route is located just to the left of the summit stairs. Walk off.

content.description: Work your way up steepening terrain placing gear where you can find it. A few vertical face moves get you through the crux. There is a bolt at the crux from the first ascent that can be clipped for "decoration". This is one of the routes Royal Robbins repeated in '69.
content.protection: Nuts and cams, screamer for the bolt. Newer bolt anchor. Bring long slings to toprope.
content.location: The Edge climbs the far left side(edge) of the west face. Walk off the lookout trail.

content.description: Crack system that is easily protectable. This climb has nice rock and is a great lead to work out your pro skills just like they did in the 1960's
content.protection: Mixed size crack pro. Try it without cams. Bolts on top.
content.location: Christian's ascends the crack system on the right side of the west face just left of where the face "rolls" around to the south face.

content.description: A fun diversion between climbs or after dinner, the ceremonial traverse, is usually done left to right. It starts with thin moves on just less than vertical rock and ends with fun jugs and heel hooks.
content.location: Cut to the right(east) off the look out trail at the small bench just before it ascends the rock. The traverse is on your left 10-20 feet past the bench.

pathTokens: South and West Faces of Ceremonial Rock
